title: Ezra Chapter 6 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ezra chapter 6 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ezra Chapter 6 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ezra Chapter 6.

questions.question: Where was the roll found that contained the record of Cyrus' decree?
options: At Achmetha, in the province of the Medes
In Jerusalem
In Babylon
In Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: At Achmetha, in the province of the Medes
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:2 states that the roll was found at Achmetha, in the palace in the province of the Medes.

questions.question: What did Cyrus the king decree regarding the house of God at Jerusalem?
options: Let the house be builded, with foundations strongly laid and height and breadth of threescore cubits
Let the house remain in ruins
Let the house be moved to Babylon
Let the house be made of gold
questions.correctAnswer: Let the house be builded, with foundations strongly laid and height and breadth of threescore cubits
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:3 describes Cyrus's decree to rebuild the house of God with strong foundations and specified dimensions.

questions.question: Who was instructed to be far from the work of the house of God according to Darius' decree?
options: Tatnai, governor beyond the river, Shetharboznai, and the Apharsachites
The priests and Levites
The elders of the Jews
The children of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Tatnai, governor beyond the river, Shetharboznai, and the Apharsachites
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:6 commands Tatnai and companions to be far from the work of the house of God.

questions.question: What was to be given from the king's goods to the elders of the Jews for the building of the house of God?
options: Expenses and provisions including young bullocks, rams, lambs, wheat, salt, wine, and oil
Only money
Only timber
Nothing, they were to provide everything themselves
questions.correctAnswer: Expenses and provisions including young bullocks, rams, lambs, wheat, salt, wine, and oil
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:8-9 specifies that expenses and offerings were to be provided from the king's goods for the building and sacrifices.

questions.question: What was the penalty for anyone who altered Darius' decree?
options: Timber would be pulled down from his house, he would be hanged, and his house made a dunghill
A fine would be imposed
Exile from the kingdom
Imprisonment for life
questions.correctAnswer: Timber would be pulled down from his house, he would be hanged, and his house made a dunghill
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:11 clearly states this severe penalty for altering the decree.

questions.question: Who prospered through the prophesying of Haggai and Zechariah while building the house?
options: The elders of the Jews
Tatnai and Shetharboznai
Darius the king
The king of Assyria
questions.correctAnswer: The elders of the Jews
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:14 says the elders of the Jews prospered through the prophesying of Haggai and Zechariah.

questions.question: On what day and month was the house of God finished?
options: Third day of the month Adar
First day of Nisan
Tenth day of Tishrei
Fifteenth day of Abib
questions.correctAnswer: Third day of the month Adar
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:15 states the house was finished on the third day of the month Adar.

questions.question: How many bullocks were offered at the dedication of the house of God?
options: One hundred
Fifty
Two hundred
Four hundred
questions.correctAnswer: One hundred
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:17 records that one hundred bullocks were offered at the dedication.

questions.question: True or False: The priests and Levites were set in their divisions and courses for the service of God as written in the book of Moses.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:18 confirms that priests and Levites were set according to the book of Moses.

questions.question: True or False: The children of the captivity kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:19 states the children of the captivity kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month.

questions.question: True or False: The king of Assyria helped strengthen the hands of the children of Israel in their work on the house of God.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:22 says the LORD turned the heart of the king of Assyria to strengthen them in the work.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Ezra 6:5: 'And also let the golden and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which is at Jerusalem, and brought unto Babylon, be ________, and brought again unto the temple which is at Jerusalem.'
options: restored
destroyed
hidden
sold
questions.correctAnswer: restored
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:5 commands that the vessels taken by Nebuchadnezzar be restored and brought back to the temple.

questions.question: According to Ezra 6:10, why were sacrifices of sweet savours offered unto the God of heaven?
options: To pray for the life of the king and his sons
To ask for rain
To celebrate harvest
To show gratitude for peace
questions.correctAnswer: To pray for the life of the king and his sons
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:10 explains the sacrifices were offered to pray for the king's life and his sons.

questions.question: Who made the decree that the house of God be built with speed according to Ezra 6:12?
options: Darius the king
Cyrus the king
Artaxerxes king of Persia
Tatnai the governor
questions.correctAnswer: Darius the king
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:12 states that Darius made the decree to build the house with speed.

questions.question: What feast did the children of Israel keep with joy for seven days as described in Ezra 6:22?
options: The feast of unleavened bread
The feast of Pentecost
The feast of Tabernacles
The feast of Weeks
questions.correctAnswer: The feast of unleavened bread
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:22 states they kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with joy.

medium.title: Ezra Chapter 6 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ezra Chapter 6 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with discouragement in their work for the Lord. Based on Ezra 6, what biblical truth would you share about perseverance in God's work?
options: God honors obedience and helps His people finish the work He commands
Human effort alone guarantees success in spiritual work
Success depends on political favors, not God's blessing
Work for God can be done without prayer or reliance on Him
questions.correctAnswer: God honors obedience and helps His people finish the work He commands
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:14-15 shows that the elders prospered and finished the house of God according to the commandment of God and the kings. This teaches that obeying God's word and trusting Him leads to successful completion of His work, encouraging perseverance (Ezra 6:14-15, Ezra 6:7, Ezra 6:12).

questions.question: How does Ezra 6 teach about God's provision and stewardship when rebuilding the temple?
options: The king's resources were to be used for temple expenses and sacrifices
The people had to fund the temple rebuilding entirely on their own
Only voluntary donations from the people were acceptable
The temple was to be rebuilt without any financial support
questions.correctAnswer: The king's resources were to be used for temple expenses and sacrifices
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:4-9 instructs that expenses for building materials and offerings were to come from the king's treasury, showing God's provision through governing authorities and the importance of responsible stewardship of resources for God's work (Ezra 6:4, Ezra 6:8-9).

questions.question: A believer feels tempted to compromise their integrity at work. What principle from Ezra 6 can encourage them to act with honesty and obedience?
options: God's decrees must be honored and disobedience has serious consequences
Integrity is optional if work demands it
Compromise often leads to quick success
Work ethics are unimportant in serving God
questions.correctAnswer: God's decrees must be honored and disobedience has serious consequences
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:11-12 warns that altering the king's decree results in severe punishment, highlighting the importance of obedience and integrity in fulfilling God's commands, even in secular contexts (Ezra 6:11-12, Ezra 6:7).

questions.question: What does Ezra 6 teach about the role of prayer and worship in church life and rebuilding God's house?
options: Daily offerings and prayers for the king were commanded alongside the rebuilding
Prayer was optional and unrelated to the rebuilding
Worship was to be postponed until the building was finished
Only the priests could pray, not the people
questions.correctAnswer: Daily offerings and prayers for the king were commanded alongside the rebuilding
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:9-10 commands daily sacrifices and prayers for the king’s life and family, showing the integration of worship and intercession with practical ministry, encouraging believers to maintain prayerfulness in all endeavors (Ezra 6:9-10, Ezra 6:16).

questions.question: Based on Ezra 6, how should believers respond to opposition or hindrances in doing God's work?
options: Trust God's protection and continue the work with support from authorities
Give up when opposition arises
Ignore leadership and work independently
Compromise God’s commands to avoid conflict
questions.correctAnswer: Trust God's protection and continue the work with support from authorities
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:6-8 shows that the king commanded officials to leave the builders alone and provide support, indicating that believers should rely on God's protection and keep working despite opposition (Ezra 6:6-8, Ezra 6:12).

questions.question: How does Ezra 6 illustrate the importance of humility and gratitude in spiritual progress?
options: The people celebrated the completion with joy and offerings, thanking God
They boasted about their own efforts without God
They ignored God's hand and took credit themselves
They were indifferent to the completion of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: The people celebrated the completion with joy and offerings, thanking God
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:16-17 describes the joyful dedication and sacrifices offered, showing gratitude and humility before God for His enabling, which encourages believers to celebrate God's work with thankfulness (Ezra 6:16-17, Ezra 6:22).

questions.question: What does the dedication of the temple in Ezra 6 teach about fellowship and serving others in the church?
options: Priests and Levites were organized in their service divisions according to the Law
Everyone served randomly without order
Only a few chosen people served in the temple
Service was unimportant for spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: Priests and Levites were organized in their service divisions according to the Law
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:18 states that priests and Levites were set in their divisions as written in Moses’ book, emphasizing orderly service and fellowship in church life that honors God’s structure (Ezra 6:18, Ezra 6:16).

questions.question: True or False: In Ezra 6, the king's decree allowed the elders and the people to rebuild the temple without any interference or financial hindrance.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:7-8 shows the king decreed that the work should be left alone and expenses paid so the elders and people would not be hindered, confirming that the rebuilding was supported and free from interference.

questions.question: True or False: Ezra 6 teaches that spiritual renewal includes both the observance of Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread with joy and purity.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:19-22 describes the children of the captivity keeping the Passover and Feast of Unleavened Bread joyfully and with purified priests, showing spiritual renewal through obedience and celebration.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Ezra 6:5, the golden and silver vessels taken by Nebuchadnezzar were to be __________ and placed in the temple.
options: restored
sold
hidden
destroyed
questions.correctAnswer: restored
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:5 states the vessels that Nebuchadnezzar took from the temple were to be restored and brought back to their place in the house of God, teaching respect for sacred things and restoration.

questions.question: How does Ezra 6 instruct believers about praying for government leaders?
options: They were commanded to offer sacrifices and pray for the king and his sons' life
Prayer for leaders was discouraged
Only priests were allowed to pray for kings
Prayers for leaders were to be secret and private
questions.correctAnswer: They were commanded to offer sacrifices and pray for the king and his sons' life
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:9-10 commands daily offerings and prayers for the king and his sons, teaching believers to intercede for leaders as part of their worship and stewardship (Ezra 6:9-10).

questions.question: What biblical virtue is exemplified by the elders and priests who obeyed the Law and held proper ceremonies after the temple was rebuilt?
options: Obedience and reverence for God's Word
Neglecting traditions in favor of new ideas
Seeking personal glory over God's commands
Ignoring the Law to simplify worship
questions.correctAnswer: Obedience and reverence for God's Word
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:17-18 shows the people offered sacrifices according to the Law and organized priests and Levites for service, demonstrating obedience and reverence for God's commands (Ezra 6:17-18).

questions.question: A believer questions the value of public celebration. What does Ezra 6 teach about rejoicing in God's blessings?
options: The children of Israel kept the dedication with joy, showing public rejoicing honors God
Celebration should be private and quiet
Joyful celebration is unnecessary and distracting
Only leaders should celebrate publicly
questions.correctAnswer: The children of Israel kept the dedication with joy, showing public rejoicing honors God
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:16 and 6:22 describe the joyful dedication and feast keeping, teaching that public rejoicing and gratitude for God's blessings is biblical and strengthens community faith (Ezra 6:16, Ezra 6:22).

questions.question: What lesson about God's faithfulness and timing can be drawn from the completion of the temple in Ezra 6?
options: God fulfills His promises in His time through faithful obedience
God delays because He is indifferent to human effort
God's promises depend on human strength alone
God's timing is irrelevant to believers
questions.correctAnswer: God fulfills His promises in His time through faithful obedience
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:15 records the temple was finished in the sixth year of Darius, according to God's command and the kings' decrees, showing God's faithfulness and perfect timing as believers obey (Ezra 6:15, Ezra 6:14).

questions.question: Based on Ezra 6, how can believers demonstrate generosity and proper stewardship in their service to God?
options: By offering appropriate sacrifices and providing for the temple service
By neglecting offerings and focusing only on prayers
By hoarding resources for personal use
By ignoring God’s commands on stewardship
questions.correctAnswer: By offering appropriate sacrifices and providing for the temple service
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:17-19 illustrates that the people offered many sacrifices and provided for the priests and Levites, demonstrating generosity and stewardship as part of worship and service (Ezra 6:17-19).

hard.title: Ezra Chapter 6 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ezra Chapter 6.

questions.question: Where was the decree that Darius the king made found according to Ezra 6?
options: At Achmetha in the province of the Medes
In Jerusalem
In the palace at Babylon
In the temple of God
questions.correctAnswer: At Achmetha in the province of the Medes
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:2 states that the roll with the decree was found at Achmetha, in the palace in the province of the Medes.

questions.question: What specific dimensions were decreed for the house of God to be built by Cyrus?
options: Sixty cubits by sixty cubits
One hundred cubits by fifty cubits
Forty cubits by forty cubits
Seventy cubits by seventy cubits
questions.correctAnswer: Sixty cubits by sixty cubits
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:3 specifies the height and breadth of the house as threescore (sixty) cubits each.

questions.question: What materials were decreed to be used in the rebuilding of the house of God?
options: Three rows of great stones and a row of new timber
Gold and silver only
Clay bricks and mortar
Iron and bronze
questions.correctAnswer: Three rows of great stones and a row of new timber
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:4 states the construction would include three rows of great stones and a row of new timber.

questions.question: What was to happen to the golden and silver vessels taken by Nebuchadnezzar from the temple?
options: They were to be restored to the temple in Jerusalem
They were to be melted down
They were to remain in Babylon
They were to be sold
questions.correctAnswer: They were to be restored to the temple in Jerusalem
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:5 commands that the vessels taken by Nebuchadnezzar be restored and placed in the house of God.

questions.question: Who were instructed to be far from the work of rebuilding the house of God?
options: Tatnai, Shetharboznai, and the Apharsachites
The priests and Levites
The elders of the Jews
The children of Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Tatnai, Shetharboznai, and the Apharsachites
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:6 instructs Tatnai, Shetharboznai, and the Apharsachites to be far from the rebuilding work.

questions.question: According to the decree, who was to oversee the building of the house of God?
options: The governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews
The Persian governors
The priests alone
The Levites alone
questions.correctAnswer: The governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:7 states the governor and the elders of the Jews were to build the house of God.

questions.question: What provision was made for the expenses of the builders of the house of God?
options: Expenses were to be given from the king's goods and tribute beyond the river
The builders were to pay themselves
Donations from the people were required
No provision was made
questions.correctAnswer: Expenses were to be given from the king's goods and tribute beyond the river
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:8 decrees that expenses be given from the king’s goods and tribute to avoid hindrance.

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT specified as to be given daily for burnt offerings?
options: Goats
Young bullocks
Rams
Lambs
questions.correctAnswer: Goats
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:9 lists young bullocks, rams, lambs, wheat, salt, wine, and oil but does not mention goats for daily burnt offerings.

questions.question: What was the purpose of the sacrifices and prayers mentioned in Ezra 6:10?
options: To pray for the life of the king and his sons
To request rain for the land
To atone for Israel’s sins
To thank for the harvest
questions.correctAnswer: To pray for the life of the king and his sons
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:10 says the sacrifices were to offer sweet savors and pray for the king's life and his sons.

questions.question: What punishment was decreed for anyone who altered the king's word concerning the rebuilding?
options: Timber pulled down from his house and hanging
Exile to Babylon
Imprisonment without trial
Fines and public disgrace
questions.correctAnswer: Timber pulled down from his house and hanging
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:11 states that whoever alters the decree shall have timber pulled down from his house and be hanged upon it.

questions.question: Which prophet(s) is/are mentioned as encouraging the elders of the Jews during the rebuilding?
options: Haggai and Zechariah
Isaiah and Jeremiah
Ezekiel and Daniel
Malachi and Joel
questions.correctAnswer: Haggai and Zechariah
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:14 notes that the elders prospered through the prophesying of Haggai and Zechariah.

questions.question: On which day and month was the house of God finished?
options: Third day of the month Adar
First day of the month Nisan
Tenth day of the month Tishrei
Fifteenth day of the month Sivan
questions.correctAnswer: Third day of the month Adar
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:15 states the house was finished on the third day of Adar in the sixth year of Darius.

questions.question: How many bullocks were offered at the dedication of the house of God?
options: One hundred
Fifty
Two hundred
Four hundred
questions.correctAnswer: One hundred
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:17 records that one hundred bullocks were offered at the dedication.

questions.question: The priests and Levites were set in their divisions and courses according to which book?
options: The book of Moses
The book of Psalms
The book of Isaiah
The book of Chronicles
questions.correctAnswer: The book of Moses
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:18 states the priests and Levites were set according to what is written in the book of Moses.

questions.question: True or False: The children of Israel celebrated the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month after the temple was rebuilt.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:19 states the children of the captivity kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the first month.

theological.title: Ezra Chapter 6 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ezra Chapter 6 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was the content of the decree found in Achmetha regarding the house of God in Jerusalem?
options: The house shall be rebuilt with strong foundations, sixty cubits in height and breadth.
The house shall be demolished and the site cursed.
The house shall be converted into a palace for the king.
The house shall remain in ruin until the end of days.
questions.correctAnswer: The house shall be rebuilt with strong foundations, sixty cubits in height and breadth.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:3 states that Cyrus decreed the rebuilding of the house of God at Jerusalem with foundations strongly laid, measuring sixty cubits in height and breadth. This reveals God's providence and faithfulness in restoring His people, consistent with God's promises in Jeremiah 29:10, Isaiah 44:28, and the prophetic hope of restoration in Haggai 1:8 and Zechariah 4:9.

questions.question: Who was ordered to cease interfering with the rebuilding of the house of God?
options: Tatnai, governor beyond the river, and Shetharboznai with the Apharsachites.
The priests and Levites.
The elders of the Jews.
The king's scribes and officials.
questions.correctAnswer: Tatnai, governor beyond the river, and Shetharboznai with the Apharsachites.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:6-7 commands Tatnai, Shetharboznai, and their companions to stay away and allow the elders of the Jews to build the house of God. This demonstrates divine authority over earthly rulers, aligning with Romans 13:1-2 on submission to governing authorities and God's sovereignty over kingdoms as seen in Daniel 2:21 and Proverbs 21:1.

questions.question: What provisions were decreed to be supplied from the king’s goods for the building of the house of God?
options: Young bullocks, rams, lambs, wheat, salt, wine, and oil.
Only gold and silver vessels.
Weapons and armor for protection.
Grain and water for the workers.
questions.correctAnswer: Young bullocks, rams, lambs, wheat, salt, wine, and oil.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:9 details the daily provision of sacrificial animals and offerings necessary for burnt offerings and temple service. This reflects the continuity of worship prescribed in the Mosaic Law (Leviticus 1-7), showing God's holiness and the need for atonement (Hebrews 9:22), and the centrality of worship in covenant relationship (Psalm 51:16-17, John 4:23).

questions.question: What was the penalty decreed for anyone who altered the king's word about the house of God?
options: Timber would be pulled down from his house, he would be hanged thereon, and his house made a dunghill.
He would be exiled from the kingdom.
He would be fined heavily.
He would be imprisoned for life.
questions.correctAnswer: Timber would be pulled down from his house, he would be hanged thereon, and his house made a dunghill.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:11 declares a severe punishment to deter opposition, emphasizing the sacredness and inviolability of God's temple and His purposes. This reflects the seriousness of opposing God's work (Deuteronomy 27:26), and God's just judgment on those who hinder His kingdom (Galatians 1:8, Revelation 22:18-19).

questions.question: How did the elders of the Jews succeed in building the house of God?
options: They prospered through the prophesying of Haggai and Zechariah.
They built it secretly without any royal permission.
They hired foreign builders to complete the work.
They rebuilt it with their own funds only.
questions.correctAnswer: They prospered through the prophesying of Haggai and Zechariah.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:14 shows that prophetic encouragement from Haggai and Zechariah was instrumental in the successful completion of the temple. This highlights the role of the Spirit-inspired prophets in motivating God's people (2 Chronicles 36:22-23, Acts 2:16-18), and the fulfillment of God's promises through His messengers (Isaiah 55:11).

questions.question: On what day and year was the house of God finished according to the decree of Darius?
options: The third day of the month Adar, in the sixth year of Darius.
The first day of the month Nisan, in the first year of Cyrus.
The tenth day of the month Tishrei, in the seventh year of Artaxerxes.
The fifteenth day of the month Elul, in the fifth year of Darius.
questions.correctAnswer: The third day of the month Adar, in the sixth year of Darius.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:15 states the completion date precisely, underscoring God's providential timing. This demonstrates God's faithfulness to His covenant promises, as also seen in Nehemiah 6:15 and prophetic fulfillment in Daniel 9:25 regarding restoration timelines.

questions.question: What was the nature of the dedication celebration for the house of God?
options: The children of Israel, priests, and Levites kept the dedication with joy and offered many sacrifices.
A solemn fast was observed without any sacrifices.
Only the elders of the Jews attended a private ceremony.
A military parade was held to celebrate the temple.
questions.correctAnswer: The children of Israel, priests, and Levites kept the dedication with joy and offered many sacrifices.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:16-17 describes a joyful dedication with numerous burnt offerings, highlighting the restoration of proper worship and communal joy in God's presence (Psalm 122:1, Nehemiah 8:10, Hebrews 12:28). The sacrifices reflect the ongoing need for atonement and thanksgiving (Leviticus 23:37).

questions.question: How many he goats were offered for sin offerings at the dedication, and what did this number represent?
options: Twelve he goats, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.
Ten he goats, representing the Ten Commandments.
Seven he goats, symbolizing completeness.
Forty he goats, signifying a generation.
questions.correctAnswer: Twelve he goats, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:17 states twelve he goats were offered as sin offerings, corresponding to Israel's twelve tribes, symbolizing corporate atonement and covenant restoration. This reflects God's covenant with Israel (Genesis 49) and the unity of God's people (Ephesians 2:14-16), and foreshadows Christ as the ultimate sin offering (Hebrews 10:1-14).

questions.question: How were the priests and Levites organized after the dedication of the temple?
options: They were set in their divisions and courses according to the book of Moses.
They were assigned randomly without regard to lineage.
They were merged into one group without distinction.
They were sent to different provinces to minister.
questions.correctAnswer: They were set in their divisions and courses according to the book of Moses.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:18 shows the restoration of Mosaic order in temple service, reflecting God's desire for holy, orderly worship (Leviticus 8; Numbers 3-4). This underscores the continuity of God's covenant and foreshadows the New Testament call for order in the church (1 Corinthians 14:40) and the priesthood of all believers (1 Peter 2:9).

questions.question: When did the children of the captivity keep the Passover according to this chapter?
options: On the fourteenth day of the first month.
On the tenth day of the seventh month.
At the beginning of the new year.
During the Feast of Tabernacles.
questions.correctAnswer: On the fourteenth day of the first month.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:19 records the observance of Passover precisely on the appointed day, affirming faithfulness to God's statutes (Exodus 12:6, Leviticus 23:5). This shows continuity of God's covenant and the typology of Christ as the Passover Lamb (1 Corinthians 5:7), demonstrating salvation history in God's redemptive plan.

questions.question: What was the spiritual condition of the priests and Levites when they killed the Passover for the children of the captivity?
options: They were purified and all were pure.
They were unclean and needed cleansing.
They were divided and disputed over the ritual.
They were absent from the ceremony.
questions.correctAnswer: They were purified and all were pure.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:20 emphasizes the holiness required for temple service, reflecting God's demand for purity (Leviticus 21:17-23). This typifies Christ's sinlessness (Hebrews 7:26) and the believer's call to holiness (1 Peter 1:16), necessary for acceptable worship and intercession.

questions.question: Who joined the children of Israel in eating the Passover meal after the captivity?
options: All who separated themselves from the filthiness of the heathen to seek the LORD God of Israel.
Only the priests and Levites.
Foreigners who were not circumcised.
The king and his officials.
questions.correctAnswer: All who separated themselves from the filthiness of the heathen to seek the LORD God of Israel.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:21 describes an inclusion of all God-fearing people who separated from pagan practices, illustrating the call to holiness and separation from sin (2 Corinthians 6:17). This aligns with God's desire for a holy people (1 Peter 2:9) and anticipates the New Testament inclusion of Gentile believers (Romans 11:17-24).

questions.question: How long did the children of Israel keep the feast of unleavened bread, and what was their attitude?
options: Seven days with joy.
Fourteen days with mourning.
Three days with fasting.
One day with solemn assembly.
questions.correctAnswer: Seven days with joy.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:22 states the feast was kept for seven days joyfully, reflecting celebration of God's deliverance (Exodus 12:15-20). Joy in God’s salvation is a theme throughout Scripture (Nehemiah 8:10, Psalm 118:24), pointing to the eschatological joy in God's kingdom (Revelation 19:7).

questions.question: What role did the king of Assyria's heart play in the rebuilding of the house of God?
options: The LORD turned the king’s heart to strengthen their hands in the work.
The king opposed the rebuilding and sent armies.
The king was indifferent and took no action.
The king demanded tribute from the builders.
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD turned the king’s heart to strengthen their hands in the work.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:22 attributes the success to God turning the king’s heart, demonstrating divine sovereignty over rulers (Proverbs 21:1, Daniel 4:17, Romans 8:28). This affirms God's providential control in advancing His purposes despite human opposition.

questions.question: What was restored to the temple at Jerusalem according to the decree of Cyrus as found by Darius?
options: The golden and silver vessels Nebuchadnezzar took from the temple.
The Ark of the Covenant.
The original temple stones from Solomon’s time.
The scrolls of the Law.
questions.correctAnswer: The golden and silver vessels Nebuchadnezzar took from the temple.
questions.explanation: Ezra 6:5 describes the restoration of temple vessels taken by Nebuchadnezzar, symbolizing restoration of worship and God's presence. This reflects God's faithfulness in restoring His people and worship (Psalm 126:1-3, Jeremiah 30:18) and anticipates the New Testament restoration in Christ (Acts 3:21).
